article:
'Keller' is a German surname. It is also sometimes an Anglicized version of the
Old Gaelic O'Ceileachair, meaning 'companionable' or
'uxorious.' http://www.surnamedb.com/Surname/keller

People whose surname is or was 'Keller' include: *Adam Keller, Israeli peace
activist *Al Keller, American race car driver *Albert Keller (1844â1920), German
painter *Albert Galloway Keller (1874â1956), American sociologist and author
*Amanda Keller (b. 1962), Australian TV personality *Andreas Keller (b. 1965),
German field hockey player *Arthur I. Keller (1867â1924), American illustrator
*Augustin Keller (1805â1883), Swiss politician *Bill Keller (b. 1949), American
editor *Carlos Keller, Chilean academic and politician. *Carsten Keller, German
field hockey player *Chaim Dov Keller, rabbi and rosh yeshiva in Chicago
*Charlie Keller, American baseball player *Chris Keller, a fictional character
in the Arthur Miller Play All My Sons *Christopher Keller, a fictional character
in the American television series Oz *David H. Keller (1880â1966), American
science fiction writer *Dianne M. Keller, American politician, former mayor of
Wasilla, Alaska *Donald G. Keller (born 1951), American science fiction and
fantasy editor and critic *Ãmile Keller (1828â1909), French writer and
